alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Kiowa; Major; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 03 at 3:13AM CST until February 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, moderate to heavy snow will move into west Oklahoma this morning and persist on and off through early afternoon. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches appear possible. Winds will gust as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills are expected with readings between 5 and 15 below zero at times. * WHERE...Major, Dewey, Custer, Washita and Kiowa Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia in a short amount of time if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to dangerous road surfaces, blowing snow will reduce visibilities and increase travel dangers.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7 for road information.
